title: Estimating the impact of supply chain network contagion on financial stability. (arXiv:2305.04865v1 [q-fin.ST])
abstract: Realistic credit risk assessment, the estimation of losses from counterparty's failure, is central for the financial stability. Credit risk models focus on the financial conditions of borrowers and only marginally consider other risks from the real economy, supply chains in particular. Recent pandemics, geopolitical instabilities, and natural disasters demonstrated that supply chain shocks do contribute to large financial losses. Based on a unique nation-wide micro-dataset, containing practically all supply chain relations of all Hungarian firms, together with their bank loans, we estimate how firm-failures affect the supply chain network, leading to potentially additional firm defaults and additional financial losses. Within a multi-layer network framework we define a financial systemic risk index (FSRI) for every firm, quantifying these expected financial losses caused by its own- and all the secondary defaulting loans caused by supply chain network (SCN) shock propagation. translated_title: 估计供应链网络传染对金融稳定性的影响
translated_abstract: 真实的信用风险评估、衡量交易对手违约造成的损失对于金融稳定至关重要。信用风险模型聚焦于借款人的财务状况，而对于其他来自于实体经济中的风险，尤其是供应链的风险，考虑较少。最近的大流行病、地缘政治不稳定以及自然灾害表明，供应链冲击确实会对大规模金融损失作出贡献。本文利用覆盖所有匈牙利公司供应链关系和银行贷款信息的独特微观数据集，估计公司破产如何影响供应链网络，导致可能出现额外的公司违约和金融损失。在多层网络框架内，我们为每个公司定义了一个金融系统风险指数(FSRI)，用于量化其自身和所有次级贷款因供应链网络(SCN)冲击传染而导致的预期金融损失。我们发现，供应链网络的传染引发的二级债务违约可能会导致能够影响金融稳定的金融系统风险指数整体上增加。
tldr: 本文利用包含所有匈牙利公司供应链关系和银行贷款信息的数据，为每个公司定义了金融系统风险指数(FSRI)，量化了其自身和所有次级贷款因供应链网络(SCN)冲击传染而导致的预期金融损失，揭示供应链网络传染对金融稳定性带来的影响。
